name: Happy Guests Lodge

reviews.text: Had a great weekend at this Warrington hotel, service with a smile, smart clean fresh decor, great big rooms plenty of space and had the best night sleep we have had in ages. We shall be back later this year when we are due to be staying in the area again and look forward to returning to happy guest lodge.
reviews.title: Fresh , Intresting hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed somewhere near Frodsham to stay and this place popped up on a google search. Pleasant reception when we arrived. Colour scheme is like a 60's acid trip in the hallways, bedrooms and the so called conference room that doubles as the breakfast room. On which note reminds me of an infant school dining room although I can't recall kids of that age and era being on acid! Woke each morning feeling like someone had punched me in ther kidneys which I get on a bed that doesn't agree with me. Free breakfast was fine. Unsure wether to give this place a thumbs up or down as it's so weird it has to be seen to be belived. Ok down, there are much better in the vicinity.
reviews.title: Strange and uncomfortable!

reviews.text: I was staying bills payed at the holliday inn in warrington. I switched from bills payed to a secondment allowance as was renting a flat, though the flat was not ready so needed a bed for 1 week.
reviews.title: Brilliant little place

reviews.text: I found this place online and what a find it turned out to be. I did not expect much due to the price but was very pleasantly supprised. the room was very spacious compared to travel lodge/holiday inn, it had all the amenities and was very clean.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic place to stay... none better!

reviews.text: I upgraded to a superior room (difference was around £7 all week so went for it :o).
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night as had to be at Manchester Airport early.
reviews.title: Good Budget Hotel

reviews.text: Very friendly welcome on reception, good room with everything you need. Perfectly adequate breakfast again with a very friendly member of staff in attendance.
reviews.title: What a find

reviews.text: Unable to find affordable accomodation in Chester at short notice due to the races being on, I stumbled across the Happy Guests lodge and although 20-30 min drive away from Chester I decided to book in. Well I am so pleased I found this place. This hotel is well named.
reviews.title: Something I can't put my finger on....

reviews.text: The hotel colour scheme is lime green and orange, very modern, but is not over powering. The family room we stayed in was very spacious and spotlessly clean. It had a double bed and bunk beds and they were so comfortable. The children are 15 and 12 and really appreciated the free WiFi as they could facebook their friends on their ipods. There is a small flatscreen TV on the wall with a DVD player that can be seen from all the beds.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: The proprietors are so friendly and welcoming and cannot do enough for you. They really know how to treat their guests and their prices are great value for what you get. The breakfast is continental, help yourself with plenty of choice of cereal, toast, waffles, orange juice, yogurt, tea, coffee and even baked beans. There is even a choice of newspapers to read and I noticed some flapjacks on the way out of the dining room but I was too full to try one. Although near a junction with traffic lights and a petrol station we had an excellent nights sleep and did not hear a thing from outside or other guests inside the hotel (probably because the beds and pillows were so comfy)
reviews.title: Continues to be a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Happy Guests Lodge several times and would recommend it. Owners are very friendly, rooms are large and clean - everything is lime green and orange but feels really cheerful. Good buffet breakfast - and good value for money.
reviews.title: really nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This isn't the first time we have stayed at this hotel. We were very mpressed by the cleanliness of the place and the friendliness of the owners, which is why whenever we need a hotel to stay at in the Warrington area it is now the only place we stay. There is plenty of parking space. It is very comfortable and offers all you could possible need for an overnight stay or more. We like the fact that we can have a drink and light meal served in our room at a very reasonable price. The owners Marjory and Geoff will do all they can to make your stay the best it can be and nothing ever seems to be a trouble to them. It is, in my view a very efficiently run hotel, which makes for a very pleasant stay. I thoroughly reccommend it.
reviews.title: Well Named Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value. Friendly check-in. Large room. New mattresses sooooo comfortable. Slept like a rock. Good value on meals at the Lodge. Decorated in 'fun' colours. Our room was orange and green - very Irish.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Located at a major intersection so access was easy and there were a three pubs about a mile and a half down the road. We ate at the Leigh Arms which was good value and one we would eat at again when in this area.
reviews.title: Just what I needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I picked this hotel as it was cheaper than others in the area, and after hearing my colleagues reviews of the other hotels, value for money I was happy with my choice. It is such a friendly couple that run this place. The service is great, but not over fussy like some hotels these days. Room was clean, fresh, large, with plenty desk space, floor space and large sofa, as well as the double bed of course. There was also good free WIFI reception in the room. The ensuite is a bit cramped but it works. The food and drink on offer is simple but having stayed 4 nights, my 4 meals were tasty and no complaints. It is situated just off the main road but I didnt hear it at all. Having stayed in many hotels, I think this one hits the mark just right for it's price range, and excels in some areas way above it's price.
reviews.title: Fantastic place for a short break

reviews.text: Booked this lodge on the strength of other trip-advisor reviews AND WASN'T DISAPPOINTED. We were visiting Chester to "deposit" my older daughter at University. The first night we had a double room [wife and myself] and a twin room [two daughters]. After the older daughter signed in at Uni on the Sunday my wife, younger daughter and I returned to the lodge for a further two nights, this time having my younger daughter put up in a bunk bed within our original double room.
reviews.title: Chester University Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout our stay the room[s] were kept spotlessly clean, with plenty of complimentary tea and coffee etc. Also, as an added bonus, hand-wash and shower gel are still provided here - free of charge!. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who themselves were spotlessly clean, cheerful at all times and exceptionally helpful with a number of questions I put to them in relation to the best places to shop for various items we needed for Uni etc.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inclusive breakfast was plentiful from the choice of fruit juices and cereals on offer to the toast, beans, yoghurts, tea, coffee and a number of preserves and other ‘concoctions’ to spread on your toast!
reviews.title: Good for overnight stay travelling along M6

reviews.text: The free internet access was an added bonus and proved useful and worked whenever we had occasion to use it [both on the lodge provided computer and my daughter's own laptop, which was easily connected]. The kettle and TV/Remote in the room also all worked perfectly - not always the case in other 'dearer' establishments I have visited!
reviews.title: A breath of fresh air for a family of 5!!

reviews.text: The lodge is easily located after coming off the M56 and although a short time away from main towns/cities, proved ideal for us as we travelled to Warrington, Chester and Runcorn.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Service

description: Happy Guests Lodge offers great value for money and fantastic rooms, backed up by a friendly & efficient service. All our En-suite Bedrooms are large - 25 sq Mt. and have 30 channel flat screen TVs, tea & coffee making facilities, telephones, etc. If you are a little bored with the corporate lodges and want a fresh and interesting place to stay than try Happy Guests Lodge!
